Description: Wall sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery vessel, probably dinos or krater; interior: reserved; exterior, white slip; head and body of lion facing right with paw raised, painted black with red on mane; dotted filling ornaments; incised details; above, black line.
Curator's comments: May be from same pot as 1888,0601.539a, but thickness and curvature do not encourage an association with 539c-e.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1173)
